newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.Africa to change CPI base, weighting from Jan 97.
newsitem.headline: S.Africa to change CPI base, weighting from Jan 97.

text.p: South Africa's Central Statistical Service said on Tuesday it was changing the base period and weighting structure for the consumer price index from January 1997.
It will also publish a core inflation rate as from January, entailing CPI excluding value added tax, fresh food, mortgage interest rates and property insurance.
The base period for the calculation of the CPI will change from 1990=100 to 1995=100 with effect from January.

The weighting structure is being updated to incorporate 1995 data, based on the October Household Survey of 1995, instead of 1990 figures. The new pattern of weights will include some entirely new indicator products such as compact discs and personal computers.
Last year's Household Survey was done for the whole of South Africa and not only the 14 metropolitan areas as was previously the case.
The CSS said the comprehensive revision of the weighting structure should make the CPI more representative of consumers' spending patterns in both metropolitan and rural areas.
